member.name: IDirect3DResource9.FreePrivateData
member.summary: Frees the specified private data associated with this resource.
member.param: Reference to the globally unique identifier that identifies the private data to free.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is D3D_OK. If the method fails, the return value can be one of the following: D3DERR_INVALIDCALL, D3DERR_NOTFOUND.

member.name: IDirect3DResource9.GetDevice
member.summary: Retrieves the device associated with a resource.
member.param: Address of a pointer to an interface to fill with the device pointer, if the query succeeds.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is D3D_OK. If the method fails, the return value can be D3DERR_INVALIDCALL.

member.name: IDirect3DResource9.GetPriority
member.summary: Retrieves the priority for this resource.
member.returns: Returns a DWORD value, indicating the priority of the resource.

member.name: IDirect3DResource9.GetPrivateData
member.summary: Copies the private data associated with the resource to a provided buffer.
member.param: The globally unique identifier that identifies the private data to retrieve.

Pointer to a previously allocated buffer to fill with the requested private data if the call succeeds. The application calling this method is responsible for allocating and releasing this buffer. If this parameter is NULL, this method will return the buffer size in pSizeOfData.

Pointer to the size of the buffer at pData, in bytes. If this value is less than the actual size of the private data (such as 0), the method sets this parameter to the required buffer size and the method returns D3DERR_MOREDATA.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is D3D_OK. If the method fails, the return value can be one of the following: D3DERR_INVALIDCALL, D3DERR_MOREDATA, D3DERR_NOTFOUND.

member.name: IDirect3DResource9.GetType
member.summary: Returns the type of the resource.
member.returns: Returns a member of the D3DRESOURCETYPE enumerated type, identifying the type of the resource.

member.name: IDirect3DResource9.SetPriority
member.summary: Assigns the priority of a resource for scheduling purposes.

param.name: PriorityNew
param.para: Priority to assign to a resource.

listheader.description:
Differences between Direct3D 9 and Direct3D 9 for Windows Vista
The priority can be any DWORD value; Direct3D 9 for Windows Vista also supports any of these pre-defined values D3D9_RESOURCE_PRIORITY.

member.returns: Returns the previous priority value for the resource.

member.name: IDirect3DResource9.SetPrivateData
member.summary: Associates data with the resource that is intended for use by the application, not by Direct3D. Data is passed by value, and multiple sets of data can be associated with a single resource.
member.param: Reference to the globally unique identifier that identifies the private data to set.
Pointer to a buffer that contains the data to be associated with the resource.
Size of the buffer at pData, in bytes.

param.name: Flags
param.para: Value that describes the type of data being passed, or indicates to the application that the data should be invalidated when the resource changes.

listheader.description: If no flags are specified, Direct3D allocates memory to hold the data within the buffer and copies the data into the new buffer. The buffer allocated by Direct3D is automatically freed, as appropriate.

The data at pData is a pointer to an interface. SizeOfData must be set to the size of a pointer to IUnknown, that is, sizeof(IUnknown*). Direct3D automatically callsIUnknown through pData when the private data is destroyed. Private data will be destroyed by a subsequent call to IDirect3DResource9.SetPrivateData with the same GUID, a subsequent call to , or when the object is released. For more information, see Remarks.

member.returns: If the method succeeds, the return value is D3D_OK. If the method fails, the return value can be one of the following: D3DERR_INVALIDCALL, E_OUTOFMEMORY.

member.name: IDirect3DResource9
member.summary: Applications use the methods of the IDirect3DResource9 interface to query and prepare resources.
